entries.detail:
1→# Specification: Meeting Mode Core Foundation (PLAN 1)
     2→
     3→## Overview
     4→
     5→This specification defines the implementation of **Meeting Mode** for the Meetdy application - a session-based meeting recorder that operates completely separate from the existing Quick Dictation functionality. Meeting Mode allows users to record entire meeting sessions, automatically generating transcripts after recording stops. Unlike Quick Dictation (which is designed for short voice snippets), Meeting Mode handles continuous long-form recordings with session-based persistence. After PLAN 1 completion, Meetdy will function as a valid meeting recorder even without AI summary capabilities.
     6→
     7→## Workflow Type
     8→
     9→**Type**: feature
    10→
    11→**Rationale**: This is a major new feature that requires:
    12→- New Rust backend managers for meeting session handling
    13→- New React components for Meeting Mode UI
    14→- New state management with Zustand
    15→- New database tables for meeting sessions
    16→- Integration with existing STT pipeline
    17→
    18→The feature is additive and must not modify existing dictation functionality.
    19→
    20→## Task Scope
    21→
    22→### Services Involved
    23→- **main** (primary) - Full-stack Tauri app with React frontend and Rust backend
    24→
    25→### This Task Will:
    26→- [ ] Create Meeting Mode toggle to switch between Quick Dictation and Meeting Mode
    27→- [ ] Implement session-based audio recording with file persistence
    28→- [ ] Build meeting session lifecycle state machine (Idle → Recording → Processing → Completed/Failed)
    29→- [ ] Create MeetingSessionManager in Rust backend
    30→- [ ] Add meeting session data model and database table
    31→- [ ] Build Meeting Mode UI with Start/Stop controls and state indicators
    32→- [ ] Integrate with existing STT pipeline for post-recording transcription
    33→- [ ] Implement crash-resilient data persistence
    34→- [ ] Add proper error handling for microphone/transcription failures
    35→
    36→### Out of Scope:
    37→- AI summary generation
    38→- Action items extraction
    39→- Search/history UI for meetings
    40→- Cloud sync
    41→- Multi-speaker detection/diarization
    42→- Transcript formatting/beautification
    43→- Real-time transcription during recording
    44→
    45→## Service Context
    46→
    47→### Main Service (Tauri App)
    48→
    49→**Tech Stack:**
    50→- Language: TypeScript (frontend) + Rust (backend)
    51→- Framework: React + Tauri v2
    52→- Build Tool: Vite
    53→- Styling: Tailwind CSS
    54→- State Management: Zustand
    55→- Database: SQLite (via rusqlite)
    56→- Key directories:
    57→  - `src/` - React frontend source
    58→  - `src/components/` - React components
    59→  - `src/stores/` - Zustand stores
    60→  - `src-tauri/src/` - Rust backend source
    61→  - `src-tauri/src/managers/` - Backend managers (audio, transcription, history, model)
    62→  - `src-tauri/src/commands/` - Tauri commands exposed to frontend
    63→
    64→**Entry Point:** `src/App.tsx` (frontend), `src-tauri/src/main.rs` (backend)
    65→
    66→**How to Run:**
    67→```bash
    68→npm run dev  # Starts Vite dev server + Tauri
    69→# Or: cargo tauri dev
    70→```
    71→
    72→**Port:** 3000 (Vite dev server)
    73→
    74→## Files to Modify
    75→
    76→| File | Service | What to Change |
    77→|------|---------|---------------|
    78→| `src/App.tsx` | main | Add MeetingMode view routing and mode toggle logic |
    79→| `src/components/Sidebar.tsx` | main | Add Meeting Mode section to sidebar navigation |
    80→| `src/stores/settingsStore.ts` | main | Add `current_mode` setting (dictation/meeting) |
    81→| `src-tauri/src/lib.rs` | main | Register new meeting commands |
    82→| `src-tauri/src/managers/mod.rs` | main | Export new MeetingSessionManager |
    83→| `src-tauri/src/settings.rs` | main | Add meeting mode settings |
    84→
    85→## Files to Create
    86→
    87→| File | Service | Purpose |
    88→|------|---------|---------|
    89→| `src/stores/meetingStore.ts` | main | Zustand store for meeting session state |
    90→| `src/components/meeting/MeetingMode.tsx` | main | Main Meeting Mode container component |
    91→| `src/components/meeting/MeetingControls.tsx` | main | Start/Stop/Timer controls |
    92→| `src/components/meeting/MeetingStatusIndicator.tsx` | main | Recording/Processing state indicator |
    93→| `src/components/meeting/index.ts` | main | Export barrel file |
    94→| `src-tauri/src/managers/meeting.rs` | main | MeetingSessionManager - core session handling |
    95→| `src-tauri/src/commands/meeting.rs` | main | Tauri commands for meeting operations |
    96→
    97→## Files to Reference
    98→
    99→These files show patterns to follow:
   100→
   101→| File | Pattern to Copy |
   102→|------|----------------|
   103→| `src/stores/settingsStore.ts` | Zustand store structure with async actions |
   104→| `src-tauri/src/managers/audio.rs` | Audio recording manager pattern with state machine |
   105→| `src-tauri/src/managers/transcription.rs` | Transcription pipeline integration |
   106→| `src-tauri/src/managers/history.rs` | SQLite database operations and file storage |
   107→| `src/components/Sidebar.tsx` | Sidebar section configuration pattern |
   108→| `src/components/settings/general/GeneralSettings.tsx` | Settings component pattern |
   109→
   110→## Patterns to Follow
   111→
   112→### Rust Manager Pattern
   113→

1→//! Meeting session management for Meeting Mode.
     2→//!
     3→//! This module provides the core data structures and manager for meeting sessions,
     4→//! which are completely separate from the existing Quick Dictation functionality.
     5→
     6→use anyhow::Result;
     7→use chrono::{DateTime, Local};
     8→use log::{debug, error, info};
     9→use rusqlite::{params, Connection, OptionalExtension};
    10→use rusqlite_migration::{Migrations, M};
    11→use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
    12→use specta::Type;
    13→use std::fs;
    14→use std::path::PathBuf;
    15→use std::sync::{Arc, Mutex};
    16→use tauri::{AppHandle, Manager};
    17→use uuid::Uuid;
    18→
    19→// Import AudioRecorder from audio_toolkit for recording functionality
    20→use crate::audio_toolkit::AudioRecorder;
    21→
    22→/// Database migrations for meeting sessions.
    23→/// Each migration is applied in order. The library tracks which migrations
    24→/// have been applied using SQLite's user_version pragma.
    25→///
    26→/// Note: This uses a separate database file from transcription history
    27→/// to maintain complete separation between Meeting Mode and Quick Dictation.
    28→static MIGRATIONS: &[M] = &[M::up(
    29→    "CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS meeting_sessions (
    30→        id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    31→        title TEXT NOT NULL,
    32→        created_at INTEGER NOT NULL,
    33→        duration INTEGER,
    34→        status TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'idle',
    35→        audio_path TEXT,
    36→        transcript_path TEXT,
    37→        error_message TEXT
    38→    );",
    39→)];
    40→
    41→/// Initialize the meeting sessions database and run any pending migrations.
    42→///
    43→/// This function opens (or creates) the database at the specified path and
    44→/// applies all pending migrations. It follows the same pattern as HistoryManager.
    45→///
    46→/// # Arguments
    47→/// * `db_path` - Path to the SQLite database file
    48→///
    49→/// # Returns
    50→/// * `Ok(())` if the database was initialized successfully
    51→/// * `Err` if the database could not be opened or migrations failed
    52→pub fn init_meeting_database(db_path: &PathBuf) -> Result<()> {
    53→    info!("Initializing meeting database at {:?}", db_path);
    54→
    55→    let mut conn = Connection::open(db_path)?;
    56→
    57→    // Create migrations object and run to latest version
    58→    let migrations = Migrations::new(MIGRATIONS.to_vec());
    59→
    60→    // Validate migrations in debug builds
    61→    #[cfg(debug_assertions)]
    62→    migrations.validate().expect("Invalid migrations");
    63→
    64→    // Get current version before migration
    65→    let version_before: i32 = conn.pragma_query_value(None, "user_version", |row| row.get(0))?;
    66→    debug!(
    67→        "Meeting database version before migration: {}",
    68→        version_before
    69→    );
    70→
    71→    // Apply any pending migrations
    72→    migrations.to_latest(&mut conn)?;
    73→
    74→    // Get version after migration
    75→    let version_after: i32 = conn.pragma_query_value(None, "user_version", |row| row.get(0))?;
    76→
    77→    if version_after > version_before {
    78→        info!(
    79→            "Meeting database migrated from version {} to {}",
    80→            version_before, version_after
    81→        );
    82→    } else {
    83→        debug!(
    84→            "Meeting database already at latest version {}",
    85→            version_after
    86→        );
    87→    }
    88→
    89→    Ok(())
    90→}
    91→
    92→/// Represents the lifecycle status of a meeting session.
    93→///
    94→/// The state machine follows this flow:
    95→/// - Idle -> Recording (start meeting)
    96→/// - Recording -> Processing (stop meeting, begin transcription)
    97→/// - Processing -> Completed (transcription success)
    98→/// - Processing -> Failed (transcription failure)
    99→/// - Failed -> Processing (retry transcription)
   100→#[derive(Clone, Debug, Serialize, Deserialize, Type, PartialEq, Eq)]
